channel.title: Change an NPC's Name?
channel.description: how do I Change an NPC's Name? is it client sided or server sided? And how do I do it? Thanks for all the help. REP ++ reward.

item.title: Change an NPC's Name?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:10, topic:369641”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=465767.msg3405889#msg3405889 date=1290307091]
EntityDef.java

In the forID method under

readValues(stream);

Add

		if (i == ###) {
			entityDef.name = "New name";
		}

[/quote]
yep hes right, took me a while to find it in pi, because ive never dealt with it, but i just looked around found it and saw his post… so yeah.[/quote]
I’m pretty good with PI, so yeah.

Read full topic

item.title: Change an NPC's Name?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

It’s client sided; go into Class5 and search for

public static final Class5 method159(int i)

And if you’re on a Bluurrs, then you should see “Green dragon (level 9999)”
Or something similar.
Then C&P

EDIT:
Never mind haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Change an NPC's Name?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Acrodox, post:3, topic:369641”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=465767.msg3405850#msg3405850 date=1290304092]
client sided, class5.java.
example:

} if(i == 2060) { // NPC ID class5.aString65 = "Zombie";//name class5.aByte68 = 1; //npc tile size class5.anInt91 = 250;//width class5.anInt86 = 250;//height class5.anInt61 = 826; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "I have to fight THAT????".getBytes(); }
[/quote]

awww, quite helpful, Ill see if this works. thanks :)[/quote]
change the 250 for width and height to 128 for both to make it normal size, i increased the size for my npc.

Read full topic
